intro: Rhodosciadium, commonly known as the "false hibiscus," is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers that resemble those of hibiscus species. The plants typically have palmately lobed leaves and produce capsules as fruits. Rhodosciadium species are native to various regions in Africa, particularly in South Africa. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and adaptability to different growing conditions.
